text.tspan: Simple API to send show a notification, similar to system-wide notifications
Each notification can have a single label and button
Notifications disappear after a predefined period (5 seconds?)
One notification shown at any one time
Up to three notifications will queue up while one is being displayed; and be shown sequentially (after this, notifications get discarded)
The following is a different approach to in-app notifications from the one we currently have. It aims to
eliminate existing issues around layout and behavior. Key features:
In-app notifications are shown towards the bottom of the window, centered.
Each notification's width is constrained by the width of its parent window:
There is also a preferred width that it will take if unconstrained:

flowRoot.flowPara: 'Foo' deleted. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Mauris ornare dolor...

text.tspan: And the notification will expand to accommodate content, until it is constrained by the window:
